name: Hilton Sydney

reviews.text: Its true that the rooms are quite small for a 5 star hotel but they aren't cramped either; the rooms are well designed and spotlessly clean and modern. This is still very much one of the better hotels in Sydney. The location is perfect and the service/staff are all top notch.
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is buffet style and about what you would expect though I'd love to see a hotel serving breakfast buffet style to cook less bacon at a time and place it in the bain marie more often; there's nothing worse than pre cooked bacon - leather at best.
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.text: However, I would definitely recommend The Sydney Hilton
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hilton and after I checked out I realized I left behind an expensive necklace. When I called the staff at the hotel to let them know, they let me know that they did find the necklace and would ship it to me in the US. They shipped the necklace to me and I received it a few days ago.
reviews.title: Mid range business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton was in a perfect location and an easy walk to most destinations. The Hotel staff made you feel at home. Available WiFi in the Hotel lobby was very convenient. Enjoyed Sydney and I hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Classic Hilton - centrally located in Downtown Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton is a great modern hotel in the heart of Sydney's CBD. We stayed on the 33th floor in a deluxe room. The room was quite small but I found it to be an acceptable size. The room is nice and modern and minimalistic, which I like. Same for the bathroom. Minibar is one of those automatic ones where you get charged if the bottle moves one inch, however it states they will bring a second fridge up for you if you wish to store your own items in there.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: Location is perfect. Right in the CBD. Entrance off George and Pitt street. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbor, 10 minutes to circular quay.
reviews.title: Great potential, small flaws

reviews.text: Staff are all great; door/reception/house keeping. Breakfast was a bit up and down when we were there, sometimes great, other times just ok - service was always excellent though.
reviews.title: Good, but with reservations

reviews.text: Health club is first class, great facilities - everything you need. Do yourself a favor and head down to the Marble Bar in the basement. Its one of the best bars I've been to, nice and relax, looks great - not open Sunday.
reviews.title: I stay here every business trip to Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel with great service. Perfect for the business traveler.
reviews.title: Glad we didnt have to pay for this hotel accom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here last weekend for a night, just to get away. I had booked on the hotel website and I assumed from all the press and descriptions that the whole hotel had been renovated. Not so! The room that I had booked was apparently a Guestroom which meant that it was refurbished but the bathroom was not renovated. Also, though I booked a King room, they gave me a tiny room with a double bed. The website was very misleading (and I do extensive research before I commit to a booking). I would not have booked to stay at the Hilton if I had known that I wasn't getting one of the new rooms. Anyway, after several conversations with reception, they eventually put us in a renovated room, which I believe is the Deluxe room. If they had not done so, it would have been an extremely disappointing stay.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very minimalist (which I normally like) but it was quite cold in atmosphere. The lobby and cafe are not very inviting. The health club is pretty good - a big pool and spa and 2 saunas and 2 steam rooms. However, the whole atmosphere of the hotel did not feel 5-star.
reviews.title: Great accommodation in downtown Sydney
Central "Up Market "Sydney Hotel
reviews.text: The best part of the stay was the buffet breakfast at the Glass Brasserie. Highlights were chef cooked-to-order omelettes, a juice bar, very good expresso coffees to order, a large variety of breads and pastries, the atmosphere and view.
I would not stay here again but would consider returning for the breakfast!
reviews.title: Beauty is only skin deep

likes.liked: — Nice lobby, good location, convenient check in desk for HiltonHHonors members
likes.disliked: — Uncomfortable beds, hideous food prices, overly chic furniture that isn't comfortable

reviews.text: The Hilton Sydney is centrally located, just a block away from the main department stores and across the road from the Queen Victoria Building with its luxury shops. The hotel was recently refurbished, and my room was very well equipped, with a proper desk and comfortable king-size bed. I was on the North side of the building, with an oblique view of the harbour and the Sydney Heads, and I was able to see the sun rise over Manly. The Glass brasserie-style restaurant was splendid - we went for a quick meal early on Saturday night and ended up staying for 3 1/2 hours, eating a variety of delicious food from the grill menu, and drinking some of the best Australian wines from the very full wine list. Room service was also good, with generous helpings and prompt service. This hotel isn't cheap (I benefited from a special conference rate), but is certainly good value if you are not constrained by a budget.
reviews.title: Brilliant city centre hotel

likes.disliked: — View blocked by other tall buildings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 2 nights for a short break in Sydney.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The location in the city centre near the Town Hall and Queen Victoria building is very central for all city activities. If arriving by car be sure to enter via Pitt St and really look for the carpark sign on the LHS as the entrance is surprisingly obscure.
reviews.title: A beautiful luxury hotel

reviews.text: The foyer is not like the usual 5 star hotel foyer as it could almost resemble a very clean modern airport area with cars dropping off on one side , two street entrances via revolving doors on each other side and a small cafe adjacent to the reception and concierge area.
reviews.title: Great location in heart of CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still, checkin was efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Sydney Weekend

reviews.text: Our room which was an executive room allowed us executive lounge access which was great. The room itself was not huge and the bathroom required carefully planned manouvering of personnel if various bathrooms goals were to be achieved at one time by two people.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: I love staying at the Sydney Hilton, first class all the way. Being a Hilton Honors member helps as the points programme is generous and I always manage to get a room upgrade.
reviews.title: The Best Hilton in Australia

reviews.text: I was upgraded to a relaxation suite as the hotel was very busy with conference people and sports people in town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and central to the major dept store and westfield

reviews.text: Room quality is 5 star, the bed and linen is first class toiletries are by Peter Thomas Roth from New York and the air-conditioning is just right. Go for a high floor above level 30 and away from the lifts .
reviews.title: Great location, bed and breakfast buffet!

reviews.text: Breakfast in the Luke Manigan Glass restaurant is very good and efficient with lots of variety , oh I forgot to mention Wi-Fi is free if your a Hilton member which is free to join.
reviews.title: Excellent and well located business hotel- note proximity to public transport, including airport train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I book online direct with Hilton and the rates are always good, they seem to put rates up when Sydney is having an event so plan ahead .
reviews.title: Great start to our Australia visit.
Hard to Fault ; One of the Best
reviews.text: The service was excellent and efficient. Really the best hotel have stayed in for a longtime.

reviews.title: Overrated and very disappointing
reviews.text: Fantastic location right in the centre of everything.
We stay in an executive club king room, lovely decor and high floor views were great.
reviews.title: Classy and close to everything

reviews.text: The Glass restaurant had lovey food.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.text: Great gym and pool.
reviews.title: Great 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Well located clean, modern hotel. Fantastic staff all very friendly and helpful. The glass brasserie is a great spot for breakfast, a glass of wine or main meal. All the brasserie staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and i was very impressed with the trouble a certain staff member went to to help an elderly man select his buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Great modern central city hotel

reviews.text: The check out staff were not remotely interested in the fact that my Hilton Honors card had expired, he really could not be bothered offering any suggestions as to what I might do and I was reminded that I would not accrue any points given I had booked online with Wotif.com. This was the only disappointing experience.
reviews.title: The most perfect business hotel

likes.liked: — It's clean, modern and the staff is quick in solving little problems
likes.disliked: — The airconditioning in my first hotelroom was leaking water. I told the staff about it and got an up-graded room. So actualy, I liked everything

reviews.text: For my work I sleep in many hotels all over the world. This is one of the greatest places I've ever been. It's near Hyde-park and the Operahouse (10 min. walk). It's absolutely city Centre.
reviews.title: A Hilton break

likes.liked: — The luxuriously comfortable beds, the health club, the foyer's ambience & helpful staff
likes.disliked: — The telephone system, the numbering system in the lift.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are modern (nice bathroom, LCD flatscreen etc...). Even the minibar is connected to the reception. You take a coke out of it and 10 min later you allready get a bill. Some probebly don't like the fast billing, but for me it's one way to say: We have thought about everything.
reviews.title: Big Reputation with Major issues in every department
Central location
reviews.text: The gym is perfect, it's big and very various and clean. The shower in the gym is excellent for a fresh-up during a late check-out.
This hotel is absolutely fantastic! From the moment of checkin to the amazing room.
reviews.title: Amazing!!! Highly recommend

reviews.text: Not sure why people complain about service or the room.
reviews.title: Love staying at the Sydney Hilton

reviews.text: Reception staff are great and met all my requests promptly with out any hassle.
reviews.title: Good corporate hotel

reviews.text: The rooms might be on the smaller side but they are very functional and comfortable
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Complete shut out electric curtains, high quality linen, comfortable beds,
reviews.title: Great location with comfy bed

reviews.text: We arrived and the front desk staff were friendly. Upon request they gave us a late checkout which worked out well since our flight wasn't until early evening. They also offered us a free room upgrade.
reviews.title: What happened to my soft bed?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first we were happy with this, until we saw the room. Apart from the high floor, I don't see how it was an upgrade. I booked a Hilton Guest Room Plus which is meant to have aqua tv and serenity bed. The upgrade was to a Deluxe room. Instead it was a normal bathroom with (very narrow) bath. This didn't bother me too much.
reviews.title: Great hotel, loved my stay

reviews.text: But where was our lovely serenity marshmallow bed???
reviews.title: only let down was that the pool was out of use!

reviews.text: Instead, the bed was hard as a rock (had to sleep on top of doona it was that bad, also considered sleeping on the couch or floor! Pretty bad since I usually don't mind if a bed is a little firm)
reviews.title: A special couple of days to celebrate a special birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not to mention they were two singles zipped together (I can't stand this when staying in a 5 star hotel! I might as well push the couches together!).
reviews.title: Very Expensive - terrible experience

reviews.text: A group of four of us stayed at the Hilton in Sydney in early November. The rooms while small (which wasn't a problem as we were never in our room) were nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. The only odd thing was the light switches which were hidden away.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast

likes.disliked: — Walking through drunk night club patrons to enter the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very small and had a odd layout, shower and a tiny bath, they would have been better off getting rid of the bath and just having a shower.
reviews.title: Wonderful Sydney hotel in perfect location.

reviews.text: Our room included breakfast which I would have to say is probably the best breakfast spread I have ever seen. In a large room there is everything from freshly squeezed juice, egg bar and then a large display of breads and pastries. The room was large and will lit and the staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Heart of the City.

reviews.text: The only downside is entering the hotel later in the evening. There are two night clubs in the hotel and as the main doors are locked at night you need to walk through the night club crowds to enter the hotel. Which is not what you would expect from a hotel of this callibre.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in staff were lovely, but the rest were pretty distracted. We got the impression they were there to hang out rather than to work. We were very surprised when we were told that not only had they lost one of the keys to our car but that they had lost our car as well! Luckily they found them eventually but once again not what you would expect. This was followed up by being told that they had lost two of our bags and could we please describe them. Turns out when they went back and had a closer look they found the bags.
reviews.title: Best sleep-in of my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a month long trip to Australia, we had three different hotel stays in Sydney. Two were at the Sydney Hilton (the third at the Four Seasons as part of a tour). The room appointments and hotel services were fine and we enjoyed breakfast buffet in the Glass Brasserie.
reviews.title: Great location and enjoyable stay at the Sydney Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Sydney Hotel is close to all central business areas sights, but does require some walking capability. In addition, there is public transportation close to the hotel that can reduce some time and effort.
reviews.title: perfect weekend away
The Best Hilton Stay Ever
reviews.text: During our stay we had a few lunches and a dinner at the Bistros on Five, in the nearby Westfield Mall. We also had a dinner at Doyles on the Wharf during our Sydney stay. The Bistro meals were reasonably priced and offered a good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my third stay in the Hilton in Sydney. This time we stayed in an ex. room.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay!

reviews.text: With a free standing bath, beautiful comfortable and clean kind size bed.
reviews.title: Near perfect...

reviews.text: The Hilton in Sydney proved to be a nice hotel to stay in with very good service. I found the little extra things that they did well made my stay enjoyable. Plus its hard to go past the very central location in down town Sydney. I would recommend - particularly if you can get it at a good rate.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Good Service

reviews.text: This is one of my favorite Hilton's world-wide - the location is good, the staff is friendly, the rooms are fresh and new (though a bit small), the breakfast is fantastic, and the health club is awesome :)
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We have been staying In this Hotel for several days now and it has been 10/10 for everything! The rooms are clean and the housekeeping service is excellent, the Breakfast Buffet in the restaurant has a great variety, the facilities are great and overall the staff are exceptional! We have had a superb stay here and it is definitely 5 star. Not to mention the very central location. All around it is a great Hotel with all the benefits of a 5 star property, in a great place, but really it's the incredible staff that make it! Highly recommend this Hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in the Best Location!!

reviews.text: I've stayed in the Hilton a few times in the last year or so as they do the odd good deal through Bookings.com. Normally it's outside my price range. The rooms are modern and classy with great facilities and often good views across the city roof tops. Staff are very friendly and well trained. Food and beverages are prohibitively costly, but then you are walking distance from hundreds of other choices, from tourist traps in Darling Harbour to cute cafes in the QVB over the road. A few niggles this time included a room key that operated the lift security temperamentally and the cafe not opening for brekkie until 7am. Too late for many travellers. Probably saved $30 by having breakfast at the airport. Finally it's worth mentioning the famous Marble Bar, one of the more interesting bars in the CBD and secreted in the Hilton basement, directly off George St.
reviews.title: Reliable luxury
Anth&Nick, UK
reviews.text: Arrived in Sydney on the second leg of our Around the World trip after an overnight flight from Hong Kong. We arrived at the hotel at 10am, and were given passes for the LivingWell gym to shower and freshen up as our room was not quite ready. On our return from the gym, the cases were already on there way to the room and we were given our keys at 11am which was great. We had booked an Exec Room with access to the lounge. The room was spotless and well presented, the bathroom walls being stained glass. I would highly recommend booking an exec room as it pays for itself, breakfast is good, not a massive choice but enough (compared to A$35 each in the Hotel Glass Restaurant), and the canapés and drinks from 6-8pm sets you up for the night. The staff throughout could not help more, very friendly and welcoming.

description: Superbly located in the hub of the city, Hilton Sydney has magnificent views and convenient access to iconic attractions including the spectacular Sydney Harbour and Opera House. Offering contemporary design that fulfils comfort and style, outstanding facilities and exceptional service, Hilton Sydney is a must for both domestic and international guests and Sydneysiders alike. Choose from stylish guest rooms and luxury suites, and rejuvenate the body and mind at LivingWell Premier Health Club with the latest gym facilities, swimming pool and stunning day spa. Sample two stylish and distinctive bars in the progressive, sleek cocktail bar, Zeta Bar with its international team of mixologists and the iconic, Victorian live music hub that’s Marble Bar. Enjoy a coffee, light meal or delectable dessert in the patisserie at Caffe Cino and one of Australia’s leading chefs and restaurateurs, Luke Mangan, provides a definitive Sydney dining experience at the award winning, glass brasserie.
